author: Staff Reporter
text:
Two camerapersons and a videographer of Tamil news media were assaulted after they attempted to capture images of erudhattam at Gidampatty on Sunday evening.

Local channel

In a brawl that ensued, the cameramen of Dinakaran and Kalaikadir and a videographer of a local channel were assaulted and their equipment damaged by few inebriated men.

According to sources, pictures of erudhattam, a traditional parading of bulls to the local deity as a mark of thanksgiving, was apparently published across some dailies as jallikattu.In its wake, the local media had attempted to capture erudhattam that was being held at Gidampatty village, here.

Coverage

Objecting to the presence of the media and the coverage of the event, a group of men allegedly in an inebriated state, attacked the media. br>

The injured mediapersons were admitted to Krishnagiri government hospital. When contacted,

Complaint awaited

Superintendent of Police R.Thirunavukkarasu said the DSP had held an inquiry and a complaint are awaited as the injured were yet to help identify the locals who had attacked them.

Asked about the erudhattam, Mr. Thirunavukkarasu said, it was different from jallikattu, and did not fall under the parameters of jallikattu.
title: Camerapersons, videographer attacked
